entries.title: Signs of Coming Russian Offensive in Ukraine Mount
entries.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky said the situation in the country’s east was very difficult, as Russia pressed for territorial gains around the city of Bakhmut and prepared for an expected offensive in the coming weeks.

entries.title: Band of Barbers, Judges and Security Guards Uses Soviet-Era Guns to Repel Russian Drones
entries.description: Groups of volunteers play a key role in a battle taking place far from the war’s front lines: protecting Ukraine from Russian drones and missiles targeting the civilian infrastructure.

entries.title: Russia's Casualties in Ukraine Near 200,000
entries.description: The toll is likely to continue to rise as the Kremlin readies a fresh offensive in the coming weeks.

entries.title: U.S. Weighs Sanctions for Chinese Firms Over Iran Surveillance Buildup
entries.description: Beijing’s exports of video recorders to Iran more than doubled in 2022 as protests swept the country.

entries.title: Japan's Leader to Dismiss Aide Over LGBT Comments
entries.description: Prime Minister Fumio Kishida called the remarks unacceptable after the aide was quoted as saying he wouldn’t want to live next to LGBT people.
